subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: European Colonialism and the Muslim World
description: A micro-lesson that makes European Colonialism and the Muslim World usable.

hook.text: By 1920, nearly every Muslim country was colonized. The humiliation reshaped Islam's relationship with the West forever.

buildup.text: Britain took Egypt, India, and Malaya. France took Algeria and West Africa. The Ottoman collapse opened the floodgates.

discovery.text: Colonizers imposed Western law, education, and values. Traditional Islamic institutions were sidelined or destroyed.

twist.text: Muslims asked: if Islam is the true faith, why are we colonized? That question sparked every modern Islamic movement.

climax.text: Colonialism created a crisis of identity. Modern Islam is shaped as much by colonial trauma as by the Quran itself.

punchline.text: Colonialism humiliated the Muslim world. That wound shaped modern Islam.

quiz.question: How did European colonialism affect the Muslim world?
options: It created a crisis of identity and sparked modern Islamic movements
